intro: Microtrichomanes nitidulum, commonly known as the glossy fern, is a small, delicate fern species native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, glossy fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on rocks or tree trunks. Its intricate structure and unique appearance make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
